heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 21 September 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 1.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 13%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 11377 lux) and cloud levels (up 1019 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 10795 lux) and cloud levels (up 631 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 1019.3m lower than yesterday, 631.0m lower than the past week, 530.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 1011m to a maximum of 4080m, averaging 1173.1m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1804.2m and 1703.8m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, dry and less humid conditions and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and it’s dim outside. Weather should be calm and steady.
